name: sial
short_description:
Sial is a  C interpreter and pre-processor that can be embedded in various tools. 

A well defined API provides the ability to access type and variables from an external source like a system crash dump. 

Runtime built-in functions can be extended via a well defined API  where standard C prototype declarations become calls calls to loadable dso functions that support the functions.

The pre-processor and compiler have the goal of enabling  cut&pasting directly from the target source code (assuming a C target). For example, Linux kernel code can be cut&pasted into a postmortem analysis session, providing a uniform debugging environment 

The Red-Hat crash tool has been offering Sial as an extension for many years now for use in the context of a Linux kernel crash postmortem analysis.

This project, will provide for better documentation and source control and will become the central point fixes and sial script libraries and examples.
